project.teaser: Due to the limitedness of current technologies, the respiratory system has historically been a sort of black box in many aspects of R&D and clinical practice. At Ebenbuild we want to open this black box by building the first accurate, patient-specific simulation models of the...
project.objective: Due to the limitedness of current technologies, the respiratory system has historically been a sort of black box in many aspects of R&D and clinical practice. At Ebenbuild we want to open this black box by building the first accurate, patient-specific simulation models of the lungs, the so-called digital twins of the lungs. In addition to patient data, these are based on first-of-a-kind predictive, physiologically accurate computational models of the respiratory system. By opening the black box for the very first time, our technology holds the potential to become the definitive source of health intelligence for respiratory diseases across a variety of use cases in healthcare and life sciences, from preclinical R&D to point-of-care. This will make Ebenbuild a deep-tech vanguard with a diversified spectrum of scalable products, each with a significant patient benefit and a global revenue potential and with our technological platform at their core. With EIC support we aim at expanding and validating the potential of our technology for provision of Twinhale tool to Biotech, MedTech and Pharma companies. Twinhale supports in-silico trials for pulmonary drug delivery and enables faster development of better inhalable treatments. Achieving this milestone will not only unlock an intriguing business opportunity, but will also be the starting point to further develop and eventually position our platform products along the entire spectrum of the medical value chain, from the inception of novel therapies to their application at the point-of-care.
project.title: In silico trials for pulmonary drug delivery with breakthrough digital twins of the lungs

category.title: Private for-profit entities (excluding Higher or Secondary Education Establishments)
category.displayCode: /Private for-profit entities (excluding Higher or Secondary Education Establishments)

category.title: Legal Basis
category.description: Programme: Legal basis for research funding

category.title: Topic
category.description: Programme: Part of the Commission work programme implementing legal basis

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
